column4: Excerpt from: http://www.linux-mag.com/id/7568/1/ It is also essential that the user records their randomly generated mount passphrase. Write it down, print it out, escrow it to a trusted server or service, store in your safety deposit box. This key, rather than your system log in password, is absolutely required if you need to restore your data from backup or migrate your data elsewhere.
